summary: This bill, the Research Integrity and Foreign Influence Prevention Act (H.R. 3744), aims to amend the Research and Development, Competition, and Innovation Act. It primarily focuses on clarifying the definition of "foreign country" for the purposes of restricting malign foreign talent recruitment. Specifically, it addresses special administrative regions and territories under the control of countries of concern, with the changes becoming effective on January 1, 2026. The bill was introduced in the House of Representatives on June 5, 2025.
